edu.washington.escience.parallel

Class Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.washington.escience.parallel.Operator
      • edu.washington.escience.parallel.Filter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DbIterator, java.io.Serializable

    public class Filter
extends Operator
    Filter is an operator that implements a relational select.

    Serialized Form

      • fetchNext

        protected TupleBatch fetchNext()
                        throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                               DbException
        AbstractDbIterator.readNext implementation. Iterates over tuples from the child operator, applying the predicate to them and returning those that pass the predicate (i.e. for which the Predicate.filter() returns true.)
        Specified by:
        fetchNext in class Operator
        Returns:
        The next tuple that passes the filter, or null if there are no more tuples
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException
        DbException
        See Also:
        Predicate#filter

      • getChildren

        public Operator[] getChildren()
        Specified by:
        getChildren in class Operator
        Returns:
        return the children DbIterators of this operator. If there is only one child, return an array of only one element. For join operators, the order of the children is not important. But they should be consistent among multiple calls.

      • setChildren

        public void setChildren(Operator[] children)
        Description copied from class: Operator
        Set the children(child) of this operator. If the operator has only one child, children[0] should be used. If the operator is a join, children[0] and children[1] should be used.
        Specified by:
        setChildren in class Operator
        Parameters:
        children - the DbIterators which are to be set as the children(child) of this operator
